page.title: 03HOUSING
page.content: THE PREDOMINANT VILLAGE ACCOMODATION CONSISTS OF COUNCIL HOUSING - WELL BUILT BRICK HOUSES REPLACING THE SMALL COTTAGES WHICH HAD BEEN BUILT AROUND THE OLD BLACKSMITH'S SHOP AND INN WHICH SERVED THE DROVERS. MANY OF THE EXISTING OLD HOUSES HAVE BEEN RESTORED OR ARE IN THE PROCESS OF BEING RESTORED. THERE IS A MODERN, WELL-KEPT VILLAGE HALL. IN THE FIELDS ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF THE VILLAGE SOME NEW LUXURIOUS BUNGALOWS HAVE BEEN, OR ARE, BEING BUILT TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THE LOVELY VIEWS DOWN THE VALLEY. THE FARMS ARE ALL OLDER BUILDINGS. THE CHAPEL HAS RECENTLY BEEN CONVERTED TO A DANCE STUDIO WHERE BALLET AND TAP DANCING CLASSES ARE HELD. THE THREE HORSESHOES PUBLIC HOUSE IS A FAVOURED STOPPING PLACE FOR TREKKERS AND CATERS FOR THE BED AND BREAKFAST TRADE.
